intro: Afrosison schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Afrosison schweinfurthii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
